senses.de: A series of linked metal rings used for fastening or securing objects and pulling or supporting loads.
senses.ex: He locked his bicycle to the post with a chain.

Tips.title: Physical Restriction
Tips.description: Indicates literal tying or locking for safety or theft prevention.
Tips.example: Chain your luggage to the rack to avoid theft.

Tips.title: Strength Implication
Tips.description: Suggests durability and ability to withstand pressure or force.
Tips.example: The chain can hold up the weight without breaking.

senses.de: A sequence of things or people that are connected or follow each other.
senses.ex: The chain of events led him to believe that he was being set up.

Tips.title: Causality Hint
Tips.description: Used to express a connection where one event leads to another.
Tips.example: A missed call started a chain of misunderstandings.

Tips.title: Order of Actions
Tips.description: Refers to steps in a process or hierarchy in systems.
Tips.example: Follow the chain of command to file a complaint.

senses.de: A group of establishments, such as stores, theaters, or hotels, under common ownership or management.
senses.ex: He owns a chain of restaurants across the country.

Tips.title: Common Branding
Tips.description: Describes businesses sharing a brand, style, or management.
Tips.example: She prefers coffee from that popular chain over local shops.

Tips.title: Ubiquity Implication
Tips.description: Implies widespread presence of the business establishments.
Tips.example: There’s a chain hotel at almost every major tourist destination.

senses.de: To fasten or secure with a chain.
senses.ex: The dog was chained to the tree.

Tips.title: Securing Effect
Tips.description: To restrict movement or access, typically for protection or control.
Tips.example: Chain the gates to prevent entry after hours.

senses.de: A unit of linear measure equal to 22 yards (20.12 meters).
senses.ex: The field is about ten chains in length.

Tips.title: Historic Measurement
Tips.description: An old unit of length, mostly used in surveying land historically.
Tips.example: The old map noted the farm’s width as four chains.

Tips.title: Cricket Field Marker
Tips.description: In cricket, 'chain' can refer to field dimensions.
Tips.example: The distance to the boundary is measured in chains.

senses.de: A structure of atoms or molecules connected in a continuous network, characteristic of many crystalline materials.
senses.ex: The polymer chains allow the plastic to be flexible.

Tips.title: Molecular Structure
Tips.description: Refers to how atoms or molecules are arranged in a material.
Tips.example: The molecular chains determine the properties of this polymer.

Tips.title: Biological Significance
Tips.description: In biology, it depicts the structure of DNA or proteins.
Tips.example: The protein chain is crucial for muscle function.

Bond.wordDefinition:
A bond refers to a connection between two things or people. It could be a connection based on emotions, trust, or a shared experience.

For example, a bond can exist between two friends who have known each other for a long time.

A bond is a connection between two things or people based on a shared experience, while a chain is a physical connection between objects made up of links or rings.

Connection.wordDefinition:
Connection means a relationship between two things, people, or ideas.

It can refer to the way two things are related or linked together. For example, a connection between two cities or a connection between two people who share a common interest.

Chain refers to a physical or metaphorical series of linked items, while connection refers to a relationship or link between two things.

Link.wordDefinition:
A chain is a series of connected links that are often used for support or to transmit mechanical power. Chains are commonly found in machines, bicycles, and as a security measure for locking something up.

A link is a single component of a chain, usually made of metal, that is used to connect the chain's components. Links are often used in jewelry, keychains, and as connectors.

A chain is made up of links, and these links are the individual components that make up a chain.

Network.wordDefinition:
A network is a group or system of interconnected things or people that are connected in multiple directions.

An example of a network would be a social network or a computer network.

A network combines multiple connections in different directions and allows for communication or exchange of information between the connected components.

A chain is a linear connection while a network is a complex and more elaborate system of connections in multiple directions.

Rope.wordDefinition:
A chain is made up of metal links that are connected together, while a rope is made up of fibers that are twisted or braided together.

Chains are typically stronger and more durable than ropes, but ropes are more flexible and easier to handle. Chains are often used for heavy-duty tasks like towing or securing heavy loads, while ropes are often used for activities like climbing, sailing, or tying down lighter objects.

Series.wordDefinition:
Chain typically refers to a linked or connected set of objects or events, whereas the word series refers to a sequence of related things.

For example, a chain can refer to a series of metal links that are connected to each other, while a series might refer to a set of books or a TV show that follows a particular storyline.

The word chain describes physical objects that are connected or linked together, while the word series describes abstract concepts or ideas that are connected in a particular order or sequence.

However, there can be overlap between the two words depending on the context. For instance, a chain of events could be described as a series of incidents that are linked together in a particular way.

String.wordDefinition:
A chain is a series of connected links or rings made of metal, while a string is a thin, flexible piece of material (such as thread or cord) made of various materials like cotton, nylon, or silk.

Strings are usually used for lighter tasks, such as tying packages, threading beads, or sewing fabric. They are also used for decoration, musical instruments, and as clothing accessories.

Strings are flexible and bendable, which makes them easier to knot and drape.

Both chains and strings have their own unique features and are used for different purposes. So, depending on the specific use, either a chain or a string can be more applicable.

Tie.wordDefinition:
Tie, on the other hand, refers to a piece of material, such as a rope, cord, or string, that is used to bind or fasten something together.

Ties are often used to hold pieces of clothing or accessories together, or to secure something loosely in place.

A chain is used to provide a strong, unyielding hold whereas a tie is used to provide a more flexible and adjustable hold.

quotes.Text: I wanted to play characters that were going to make me better and really challenge me to raise my skill level up or that were just interesting to me personally. I want to be the best actor I can be, and I want to be the most creative actor I can be. I want to take on roles that will move the chain to where I finally want to go.
quotes.Name: Brian Michael Smith

quotes.Text: I probably spend more on food than a lot of people, and I feel good about the whole food chain I'm supporting when I'm doing it. But even I have to remind myself. I'm always complaining about the prices at the farmer's market.
quotes.Title: American Educator
quotes.Name: Michael Pollan

quotes.Text: It is very rare that I am just coming up with melodies off the top of my head. I usually am responding to something - it could be chains dragging on the floor - but I am usually responding to something.
quotes.Title: American Musician

quotes.Text: The most trusted way to keep moving up that value chain is to keep investing in individuals - to help them grow in knowledge and skills. Education is hard. It takes individuals to do the hard work.

quotes.Text: Your success, or lack of success, is your responsibility. Even when you have a chain of command that you don't like as well, its your responsibility to work with the up chain of command.

quotes.Name: Jocko Willink

quotes.Text: Rarely do I do film press because I'm so low on the food chain of the movie, and for me it's just this thing I did for four weeks before the next tour started.

quotes.Name: Henry Rollins

quotes.Text: A wise human would have an understanding of the supply chain and how the pieces fit together. But it's against our nature to think about it.
quotes.Title: American Writer
quotes.Name: Paolo Bacigalupi

quotes.Text: A chain is no stronger than its weakest link, and life is after all a chain.
quotes.Title: American Philosopher
quotes.Name: William James

quotes.Text: Love is a chain of love as nature is a chain of life.
quotes.Title: American Novelist
quotes.Name: Truman Capote

quotes.Text: I think life is a chain of events.
quotes.Title: Swedish Musician
quotes.Name: Zara Larsson
